subject: RE: [junit] LOADER CONSTRAINTS VIOLATED
msgSnippet: I follow this mailing list very closely and see this question a lot. I understand that there s a work-around to exclude these classes however, I beginning to
messageBody:
I follow this mailing list very closely and see this question a lot. I
understand that there's a work-around to exclude these classes however, I
beginning to wonder if it is adequate to require this work-around. The sheer
number of problems I see with the class loader leads me to think that:

1. This issue is not clearly documented.
2. This is likely due to poorly written code. I don't have any experience
with custom class loaders but my gut tells me that there's got to be a
better way to do this.

Perhaps this issue has already been discussed in the developers' list but I
think we need an explanation for why this problem has not (or can not) be
fixed here as well. For instance, it seems to me that we could catch these
errors instead of letting them fall through and stop the execution of the
application.

Thoughts? Comments? Flames?

Chris Eppstein

-----Original Message-----
From: Peter Spitz [mailto:pspitz@...]
Sent: Wednesday, March 13, 2002 10:43 AM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] LOADER CONSTRAINTS VIOLATED


Romilson,

Search the message archive of this mailing list for "loader constraints
violated". You'll see that others have had this same problem and you'll find
the solution.

Thanks,
Peter
